dmca.title: MSN User Claims Scraped Data
dmca.body:
1. The copyrighted work at issue is my MSN Spaces page the text that appears on http://spaces.msn.com/nicolelombre which has been scrapped by: www.en.bitacle.org

2. All of the material I have posted on this MSN spaces pages is copyrighted content, per MSN.

When a search is conducted on google.com using the query "nicolelombre", all results directly link to the web page on "www.en.bitacle.org" that infringes on the copyrighted text I identified in item #1 above. You have already removed the results listed in my first complaint, a fax dated March 2, 2007, (helpdesk job # 121317609). The following list includes additional results that also need to be removed:

http://en.bitacle.org/v/7zv7-xztio0/san-diego-vs-san-francisco.html

http://en.bitacle.org/v/7zv7-xztio0/photo-album-camera-phones-suck-.html

http://en.bitacle.org/v/7zv7-xztio0/working-on-a-sunday.html

http://en.bitacle.org/v/7zv7-xztio0/photo-album-washington-trip.html

http://en.bitacle.org/v/7zv7-xztio0/b.html

In addition, my copyrighted material is now private and is inaccessible to viewers unless I have given permission to the individual. So when the "referred" original link listed on the en.bitacle.org page ( http://spaces.msn.com/nicolelombre..etc.) is clicked on, it is marked restricted. They are referring to material on a personal website that cannot be confirmed as correct, nor updated. There is no way to validate that what they say appears on an outside page, actually does.

I have sent several emails to en.bitacle.org but have received no response.

3. My email address is [Private]@gmail.com

4. [Private]@bitacle.org - I wish you good luck

5. I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

6. I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

7. <[Private]>

8. Send the written communication to fax: ([Private], Attn: Google Legal Support, DMCA Complaints
